result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Carter on 10/10/2022.

8:34 AM Defendant Meguel A Watts in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Meguel A Watts.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for bail/bond hearing. 

Defense makes arguments in support of motion to lower cash bail an/or a signature bond. 
The State makes arguments in opposition to any modification of cash bond. 

For reasons stated on the record, the Court denies the Motion for Bail Modification. 

Atty Wolff requests to set case 22cf1399 for jury trial and status following speedy trial demand. 

Court will set for jury trial and jury status on 22CF1399, other cases to follow.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Motion to Modify Bail

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/03/2022 - Okay to set for 10/10/2022 Hearing.**

9:42 AM Defendant Meguel A Watts in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Meguel A Watts.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
City of Muskego Detective Andrew Kraus sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Schmidt.  Cross examination by Atty. Wolff.  Redirect.  Recross.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Schmidt makes closing statements and moves for bind over.  Atty. Wolff makes closing statements and moves to dismiss case.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Speedy trial demand.  Atty. Wolff will be filing a motion.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 09/25/2022 regarding his case

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 09/30/2022 - No action.**
Atty Wolff

9:32 AM Defendant Meguel A Watts in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Meguel A Watts.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court notes the State did file a letter requesting an adjournment of the preliminary hearing as the Detective is unavailable and will be available next week.  
Attorney Menden states they are objecting to adjourning the preliminary hearing and never received notification this matter was converted to a status conference.
The Court notes no objection was received in writing by defense though the Court had granted converting today's date to a status date due to Marsy's Law.  
The Court places findings and does find good cause to briefly adjourn the preliminary hearing due to the unavailability of the witness.  
Attorney Menden does not want to schedule the preliminary hearing past next week but due to being unavailable for preliminary hearing all of next week, she will need to withdraw so new counsel may be appointed within their office. 
Court grants the motion for Attorney Menden to withdraw as counsel.  
Public Defenders Office to appoint new counsel.  
Attorney Menden puts on record that the defendant has not waived the time limits associated with the preliminary hearing.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. 
The Court sets a new preliminary hearing date next Friday and further a status of counsel date the new prior.
Bail remains as fixed. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on September 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Request for adjournment  **Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 9/13 "The matter will be converted to a status conference. Due to Marsy's law, the matter cannot be adjourned."

Protective Order

Proposed Protective Order
The original document was titled: Proposed Order
The original history event date is: 09-06-2022

ADDRESS INFO for Meguel A Watts
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: 3216 N 30Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53216

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services. Defendant is not to come within 2 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

3:10 PM Defendant Meguel A Watts in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Meguel A Watts. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. The Court will set this matter for a status of the preliminary hearing with the Trial Court to tag along with the defendant's other matter. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
